reflection_law.description: Before significant actions or recommendations, the agent must reflect: 'Am I going beyond necessary information or current context (including MCP memory)? Is there any conflict with the current task?' If yes, the agent MUST confirm with the user before proceeding.

allowed: Refactor scripts minimally without breaking existing flows
disallowed: Network calls that violate licensing or TOU

coding.style: Keep changes small, focused, and consistent with existing batch/shell style.
coding.duplication: Consolidate duplicate functions; do not introduce new duplicates.
coding.compat: Preserve Windows 10/11 support; guard features by version checks.
coding.downloads: Pin versions and verify checksums when feasible.
coding.safety: Fail fast with clear messages; add prompts for destructive ops.
coding.comments: Use English comments; prefer :: over REM in batch.
coding.labels: Batch labels lowerCamelCase; verbs first; menu labels end with 'Menu'; avoid hyphens.
coding.variables: Env vars UPPER_CASE; local vars descriptive lower_snake_case.

phase: Document manual steps if automation is not possible

security.privilege: Elevate only when required. Explain why.
security.downloads: Prefer official sources. Avoid --ignore-checksums unless justified.

docs.long_form: Place human-readable technical detail in docs/

role_selection.coaching: Use when editing MCP memory or before selecting a repo
role_selection.engineering: Use when working inside a repo with .agent present

vcs.large_changes: Open PR for review before merging.
vcs.small_changes: Commit directly for low-risk tweaks (docs/minor fixes).
vcs.major_issues: Open Issue for major bugs/refactors or release planning.
vcs.versioning: Use SemVer for big updates; include date in script header.
